title: Qatar Airways Showcases Its Customer Experience Offering at The Global Aviation Festival In LondonTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Qatar Airways Showcases Its Customer Experience Offering at The Global Aviation Festival In London Published on : Tuesday, September 29, 2015
Qatar Airways joined executives from various airlines and airports around the world at the Global Aviation Festival, recently held in London, to showcase its end-to-end customer experience offering.
The event, hosted by Terrapinn, gathered leaders of global aviation companies to discuss key innovations and share ideas on how to boost profits and improve the overall customer experience.
Delegates visiting the event gained knowledge about the latest e-Commerce, customer experience and operational technology that assist airlines and airports in meeting the needs of travellers today, with more than 50 technical demonstrations from some of the leading travel technology companies on display over the two days.
Qatar Airways’ Senior Vice President Customer Experience, Mr. Rossen Dimitrov gave a presentation focusing on the emerging opportunities and challenges faced by the global aviation industry – presenting key innovations behind the design of customer experience across all touch points at Qatar Airways, and how the airline has taken a unique approach to creating a five-star end-to-end travel experience for its passengers.
“It was a highly interesting and informative experience that was thoroughly enjoyed by the team from Qatar Airways that attended the Global Aviation festival, said Mr. Dimitrov. “We are always looking at ways to better our award-winning customer experience and we look forward to implementing many new innovative ideas that are ultimately going to leave Qatar Airways’ passengers with even more positive experiences.”
Representatives in attendance at the Global Aviation Festival included guest speakers from a number of the airlines around the world. Each speaker highlighted important points on the future of air travel and the importance of enabling customers to stay connected via Wi-Fi connectivity on-board the aircraft for the duration of their journey, whether the traveller wants to catch up on e-mails, stream videos or update their blog live on-board the flight.
Qatar Airways, the national carrier of the State of Qatar, is one of the fastest growing airlines operating one of the youngest fleets in the world. Now in its 18th year of operations, Qatar Airways has a modern fleet of 166 aircraft flying to 152 key business and leisure destinations across six continents. The airline has won a number of awards including being voted by passengers as the Airline of the Year for the third time and Best Airline in the Middle East for the ninth time at the 2015 Skytrax Awards.
